definition: opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4] (TCM)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
term in TCM describing the progress of disease as an opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4]

sentences.english: The occurrence and development of a disease are related to both the vital-qi and pathogenic factors.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的發生和發展與正邪兩方面因素有關。

sentences.english: Sipkins wanted to find out what happens when the two worlds collide.
sentences.chinese: 斯普金思想要發現正邪兩個世界衝突時會發生什麼。

sentences.english: The other prisoners of war have also came to the scene, boils down to watch the competition.
sentences.chinese: 其它的戰俘們也紛紛來到現場，觀看此次正邪較量。

sentences.english: The good vs. evil battle will continue, even without Jobs.
sentences.chinese: 正邪之爭仍將延續，就算喬布斯故去後也依然會如此。

sentences.english: Desert Wind and Smoke, the color of good and evil in a world war, about to begin.
sentences.chinese: 大漠風煙間，一場天地變色的正邪之戰，即將展開。

sentences.english: In this state, to distinguish right opposite seemingly important.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的境地下，正邪對立似乎無關重要了。

definition: the hidden and the visible/that which can be seen and that which cannot/darkness and light/night and day/wisdom and ignorance/evil and good/the living and the dead/men and ghosts
Wuji county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊地區|石家庄地区[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1 di4 qu1], Hebei/The Promise (name of film by Chen Kaige)
lit. true religion/orthodox religion/orthodox Christianity/Islam (in the writing of Chinese or Hui theologians)
